member.summary: Provides the base interface for all files that can be packaged into the WSP and deployed to SharePoint. These files share a set of deployment related properties.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.IDeployableFile.DeploymentPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the path of the file as it will be deployed in SharePoint relative to the base path represented by DeploymentRoot.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.IDeployableFile.DeploymentRoot
member.summary: Gets the base path where SharePoint will place the file.
member.remarks: This value uses tokens: {SharePointRoot} => Root of the SharePoint hive. {FeatureName} => Name of the feature in which the ProjectItem is being included. {ClassResourcePath} => Class resource path on SharePoint. This depends on whether the assembly is being deployed to GAC or the web application.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.IDeployableFile.DeploymentType
member.summary: Gets the the type of deployment to be performed to a file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.IDeployableFile.DeploymentUrl
member.summary: The absolute SharePoint url where this file is going to be deployed.
member.remarks: When DeploymentType is RootFile, TemplateFile or ElementFile, this property returns an absolute url. Otherwise, it returns null.

member.name: E:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.IDeployableFile.DeploymentPathChanged
member.summary: This event is raised when DeploymentPath is changed.

member.name: E:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.IDeployableFile.DeploymentTypeChanged
member.summary: This event is raised when DeploymentType is changed.
member.remarks: DeploymentType property change in most cases will follow up with the DeploymentPathChanged event. While in the DeploymentTypeChanged event handler you can access only old value of the DeploymentPath property.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.INotifyObjectDisposing
member.summary: Class implementing this interface notifies when object is disposing. When object is disposing it can be used to perform clean up tasks such as unsubscribe from event handlers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.INotifyObjectDisposing.IsDisposing
member.summary: Gets value indicating that object is disposing.
member.remarks: It is safe to check this property even after object is disposed. It remains set to true after the object is disposed. If class implements INotifyPropertyChanged then PropertyChanged event will be raised for this property when object starts dispose process.

member.name: E:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.INotifyObjectDisposing.Disposing
member.summary: This event is raised when object is disposing.
member.remarks: Handler for this event can be used to unsubscribe from events and release any references or resources. Most properties are still accessible in the handler for this event. It complements the INotifyObjectDisposed.Disposed event where access to any object member will cause the ObjectDisposedException.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.INotifyObjectDisposed
member.summary: Class implementing this interface notifies when object is disposed. After object is disposed it cannot be used anymore and any call to its methods or properties will result in throwing ObjectDisposedException.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.INotifyObjectDisposed.IsDisposed
member.summary: Gets value indicating that object is disposed. It is safe to check this property even after object is disposed. If class implements INotifyPropertyChanged then PropertyChanged event will be raised for this property when object becomes disposed.

member.name: E:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.INotifyObjectDisposed.Disposed
member.summary: This event is raised when object is disposed.
member.remarks: After object is disposed any call to its properties or methods will throw ObjectDisposedException. This event can be used to remove a reference to the object that was just disposed. Access to any object member in this event will throw the ObjectDisposedException. If you need to unsubscribe from events or access any other object member consider the INotifyObjectDisposing.Disposing event if it is available.

member.name: E:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.ISharePointProjectItemEvents.ProjectItemOpen
member.summary: Event is raised when a SharePoint Project item folder is opened.
member.remarks:
User can either double click on the SharePoint project item folder, press Enter key or execute "Open" command.
A project item type provider or extension can override the default behavior by setting SharePointProjectItemOpenEventArgs.Handled property value to true. By default the SharePoint project item uses the instance and opens a default editor for it. The property can be changed in the event handler.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.IObservableModelElement
member.summary: This interface represents a DSL model element that exposes property changing/changed events.
member.remarks: DSL model elements support property change events through their custom property descriptors. These are used, for example, by WPF data binding. However, they are not very convenient for programmatic use. Furthermore, if we support the "traditional" INotifyPropertyChanging/ed interfaces, WPF will prefer them over the property descriptor for two-way binding which will fail because they do not use implicit transactions. Therefore, we have our DSL model elements implement the traditional events without implementing the interfaces themselves.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.SharePointCommandException
member.summary: Exception raised when a SharePoint command failed.
member.remarks: While Visual Studio SharePoint tools run inside of Visual Studio 32 bit process, the SharePoint commands executed against SharePoint object model run in a separate 64 bit process vssphost4.exe. Any exceptions raised by the code in SharePoint command in the vssphost4.exe process are raised as SharePointCommandExecption in the code run inside of the Visual Studio process. SharePoint commands are invoked using ISharePointConnection interface members.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.SharePointConnectionException
member.summary: Exception raised when creating a SharePoint connection fails. SharePoint connection might be created on-demand when an attempt to execute a SharePoint command is done. Hence, this exception can also be raised on command invocation.
member.remarks: This exception is usually raised in one of the following conditions: 1. SharePoint server is not locally installed. 2. Local instance of SharePoint server in not running. 3. The current user does not have appropriate permissions in SharePoint. 4. Visual Studio is not launched in elevated mode or the current user is not an administrator on the local machine. 5. .NET 3.5 SP1 is not installed on the machine. 6. The Site URL of the project is not valid. 7. An internal communication error has occurred.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.ISharePointProjectItemType
member.summary: This interface represents a type of a SharePoint Project Item (SPI). It allows to associate custom data with a type because it inherits from the IAnnotatedObject interface.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.ISharePointProjectItemType.Id
member.summary: Gets the unique ID of the SharePoint Project Item type. This is usually a string which looks like namespace qualified type. The ID is initialized by project from the SharePointProjectItemTypeAttribute.ProjectItemTypeId value provided for the ISharePointProjectItemTypeProvider component. The ID must match to the ID stored in the spdata file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.ISharePointProjectItemType.Name
member.summary: Gets friendly name of type shown in designers. By default it is the Id.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.ISharePointProjectItemType.SupportedAssemblyDeploymentTargets
member.summary: Gets deployment location of the assembly that is supported by this ProjectItem.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.ISharePointProjectItemType.SupportedDeploymentScopes
member.summary: Gets scope at which the SharePointProjectItem's deployment is supported in SharePoint. Among other things, this is used in selecting a compatible feature for auto-add, and restricting the feature and package designer UIs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.ISharePointProjectItemType.SupportedTrustLevels
member.summary: Gets trust levels in SharePoint that the SharePointProjectItem supports.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.ISharePointProjectItemType.ProjectService
member.summary: Gets the SharePoint Project Service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.ISharePointProjectItemType.IsValid
member.summary: Gets a Boolean value indicating that the project item is valid.
member.remarks: A project item type is considered to be valid if SharePoint project can find a component implementing the corresponding project item type provider and that this provider was successfully created and initialized the type.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.Validation.IFeatureValidationContext
member.summary: This interface represents the contextual data passed to feature validation rules during validation.

member.summary: This interface represents the contextual data passed to package validation rules during validation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.Validation.IValidationContext
member.summary: This interface is the base interface for objects providing contextual data during validation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.Validation.IValidationContext.RuleViolations
member.summary: Returns the current collection of rule violations.
member.remarks: Validation rules should add this collection as violations are found.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.Validation.IPackageValidationContext.Package
member.summary: Returns the package on which validation is being performed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.Validation.IFeatureValidationContext.Feature
member.summary: Returns the feature on which validation is being performed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.Validation.IFeatureValidationRule
member.summary: This interface represents a rule to be applied when validating a feature.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.Validation.IFeatureValidationRule.ValidateProjectItem(Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.Validation.IFeatureValidationContext,Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.ISharePointProjectItem)
member.summary: Determines whether a feature would violate this rule if the specified project item were added.
member.param: Contextual data associated with the feature and validation.
The project item with which the feature is to be validated.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.Validation.IFeatureValidationRule.ValidateFeature(Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.Validation.IFeatureValidationContext)
member.summary: Determines whether a feature currently violates this rule.
member.param: Contextual data associated with the feature and validation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.Validation.IPackageValidationProvider
member.summary: This interface represents a component that can validate a SharePoint package and its constituent parts. Validation consists of the application of rules to the package and returning which, if any, have been violated.
member.remarks: This interface is not expected to be implemented by third parties.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.Validation.IPackageValidationProvider.ValidateFeatureForProjectItem(Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.ISharePointProjectFeature,Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.ISharePointProjectItem)
member.summary: Determines whether a feature is compatible with a project item. That is, whether the project item could be added to the feature.
member.param: The feature to validate.
The project item with which the feature is to be validated.
member.returns: The result of the validation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.Validation.IPackageValidationProvider.ValidateFeature(Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.ISharePointProjectFeature)
member.summary: Determines whether a feature, as a whole, is valid. That is, whether the feature or any of its constituent project items violate any of the validation rules.
member.param: The feature to validate.
member.returns: The result of the validation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.Validation.IPackageValidationProvider.ValidatePackageForProjectItem(Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.ISharePointProjectPackage,Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.ISharePointProjectItem)
member.summary: Determines whether a package is compatible with a project item. That is, whether the project item could be added to the package.
member.param: The package to validate.
The project item with which the package is to be validated.
member.returns: The result of the validation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.Validation.IPackageValidationProvider.ValidatePackageForFeature(Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.ISharePointProjectPackage,Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.ISharePointProjectFeature)
member.summary: Determines whether a package is compatible with a feature. That is, whether the feature could be added to the package.
member.param: The package to validate.
The feature with which the package is to be validated.
member.returns: The result of the validation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.Validation.IPackageValidationProvider.ValidatePackage(Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.ISharePointProjectPackage)
member.summary: Determines whether a package, as a whole, is valid. That is, whether the package or any of its constituent parts (features and project items) violate any of the validation rules.
member.param: The package to validate.
member.returns: The result of the validation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.Validation.IPackageValidationRule
member.summary: This interface represents a rule to be applied when validating a package.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.Validation.IPackageValidationRule.ValidateProjectItem(Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.Validation.IPackageValidationContext,Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.ISharePointProjectItem)
member.summary: Determines whether a package would violate this rule if the specified project item were added.
member.param: Contextual data associated with the package and validation.
The project item with which the package is to be validated.
member.remarks: If this rule applies only to features in a package, this method should do nothing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.Validation.IPackageValidationRule.ValidateFeature(Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.Validation.IPackageValidationContext,Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.ISharePointProjectFeature)
member.summary: Determines whether a package would violate this rule if the specified feature were added.
member.param: Contextual data associated with the package and validation.
The feature with which the package is to be validated.
member.remarks: If this rule applies only to project items in a package, this method should do nothing.

member.summary: The ID of the referenced item.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.ISharePointProjectMemberReference.ProjectPath

member.summary: Returns true if any of the rule violations Severity property are set to ValidationRuleViolationSeverity.Error

member.summary: Returns the read-only collection of violated rules found during validation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.Validation.ValidationRuleViolationSeverity
member.summary: This type represents the possible severities of packaging rule violations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.Validation.ValidationRuleViolationSeverity.Information
member.summary: This value represents a purely informative message to be displayed to the user, but does not indicate a semantic or physical issue with the package.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.Validation.ValidationRuleViolationSeverity.Warning
member.summary: This value represents a rule violation that may result in package deployment errors on a SharePoint server, but will not prevent a package from being created. This violation may be ignored by the user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.SharePoint.Validation.ValidationRuleViolationSeverity.Error
member.summary: This value represents a rule violation that may prevent a package from being created. This violation must be fixed by the user.
